title: Is Telugu language rich in literature? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes it is very rich. A cursory glance of any book on the history of Telugu literature including folklore attests to its richness. There is no need to drop names from Nannaya on wards to current practising poets and writers. Telugu is unique in that it absorbs words from non-Telugu langauges like Sanskirt, Urdu and of late English and makes it its own. Literature and literary forms like avadhaanams are unique to Telugu. However, I drop some names and works just to add to my claim. Kavitraya Mahabharatam (Nannaya, Tikkana, Errana) Bhagavatam (Potana) Prabandha Kavitvam (Srinatha, Peddana et al) Sataka Literature (Sumati satakam, Kumari satakam etc) 20th century movements and writers like Rayaprolu, Viswanatha, Devulapalli, SriSri and post modern writers of today. All enriched Telugu literature. -Vasu-
